channel.title: I keep getting this error message
channel.description:
I got this error message right after I changed my environment variables,
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:252) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:320) Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
I've been stuck with this message and its keeping me and my friend from running our server we've been working on, if you can help it would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

item.title: I keep getting this error message
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

`Rich:

It can’t find the client class.

Read full topic

item.title: I keep getting this error message
item.dc:creator: @big_b140 big b140
item.description:
@big_b140 wrote:

Well here’s what I have for mine and it works for me

Classpath:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;

That’s the latest JDK.

Read full topic

item.description:

My Env Variables are screwed up and i havent been able to get them to work for a while now, do any of you know what to set the Path and Classpath for the recent jdk16.0.14 or something but i know the end is 14 and i just copied the address from the C drive. Using Vista On administraitor account.

So one answer would be to change them back ^.^
